title: Truly scrumptious
text: I found the eatery by chance and selected dishes based on descriptions. So very pleased with quality of food. Portions were large and I have enough left for 2 more meals. Will definitely order from them again. I used them in lockdown and food was well packed and delivered well via Just Eat.

title: Excellent value Sunday Roast
text: Have discovered this place during the CoVid lockdown and have visited several times since. Have used their Sunday lunch takeaway a couple of times and it’s truly scrumptious. Hence the review. Comes v well packed and can be easily reheated at home. Very generous portions too. Will return well many more times. The coffee shop is part of a larger business with a v large car park.

title: Huge portions oozing quality
text: So impressed with the quality and portion sizes of takeaways. I live 15 min drive away and the food is well packed and remains warm. I have a good appetite but am almost full after eating half their Christmas sandwich or their massive Christmas Yorkshire pudding wrap with all the trimmings. Their chunky chips are superb. Today I requested salad instead of chips with my sausage, bacon, Brie and cranberry panini and the salad was beautifully packed in a large box. Was surprised to find a generous amount of coleslaw too. Cannot recommend this place enough. I have always pre-ordered but still wait about 5-10 mins whilst my food is freshly packed. I get priority in the queue. Their huge and delicious wedge of Yorkshire curd tart is recommended too. Excellent value for me. Travelling there is a good excuse to take my car for a run when it remains on my drive these days during CoVid.

title: Very disappointed is putting it politely
text: Just ordered their bourbon burger via Uber Eats. Burger was v dry and the deep fried bacon on the burger was horrible. Hand cut chips were v oily. I will not use their offerings again.

title: Excellent area to pick up good quality souvenirs
text: Found a street full of excellent quality souvenirs at reasonable prices. Much better selection than run of the mill standard souvenirs sold in other Greek shops. Well connected by many kinds of public transport. Good quality and reasonably priced hotels and restaurants in the area too. How I wish I had discovered this place sooner.

title: Excellent value for money
text: Ideally situated on a corner of main road that links Hadrian’s gate to Syngrou-Fix metro. In fact it is closer to Acropoli metro which is not on the main road. Had pork gyro which was well packed in aluminium foil lined bag. Was cheap and substantial for a meal.

title: Excellent food and service.
text: Excellent food and service. They serve Chicken and pork souvlaki, Greek and other salads and cubed pieces of chicken or pork freshly grilled on a BBQ. Enjoyed my chicken soulavki so much that I ordered a second one even though I was full. Wish I had found the place sooner. It is situated v close to the exit of the Acropoli metro station. They have chairs and tables outside to sit under cover but thanks to the corona virus and Athens closing all tourist attractions they had closed their outdoor cooking area. Will definitely return when I come to this area again on a future trip to Athens

title: Part of the Acropolis visit
text: You must go and visit the Acropolis museum with a guide to make your visit more meaningful. Else it is just ruins.

title: Beautiful
text: Was lucky to have had the commentary of a very informative guide and an earlier visit to the Acropolis museum to make the visit more meaningful. Would strongly recommend a half day sightseeing tour with museum and help of guide to make your trip to this place more interesting

title: Fabulous
text: No visitor to Athens can go visit the top of this peak. Acropolis is the highest point on this hill and has the Pantheron, temple of Nike and other historical sites. Had the benefit of a tour guide that made it so much more interesting

title: Beautiful
text: Just returned from the Acropolis where this is located. Cannot enter this place but can get close to it. Good views around

title: Must see this before going to Acropolis
text: This is a must see especially with a guide as it puts the ruins on Acropolis in perspective. Initially I was not going there but am so pleased that I changed my mind. I am a person who does not like museums but the tour guide’s commentary put so much in perspective before going to Acropolis. Beautiful views of the Parthenon from there too. The architect of the museum has tried to reproduce many elements of the Parthenon. Cannot recommend this enough

title: Just perfect for solo lady traveller
text:
Cannot praise this hotel enough. Just off the tourist track situated between 2 metro stations - Syncgrou-fix and Acropolis. The former has some steps at the end so I shall avoid using again on my return. The latter has a lift and elevator from ground level.

All the hotel staff speak good English and are v welcoming and helpful. Room was v clean and exceedingly comfortable. V little traffic noise even though it is on a v busy main road. Breakfast was excellent with a lot of selection. Lots of restaurants around and a lovely bakery across the road for light bites. Only issue with the place if I had to find a fault is that there are steps to get to reception and then to the elevator. If you are lucky receptionist is helpful.

I am returning back in a week. Very pleased with this place. Excellent value for money. The hotel website gives the best rates.

title: Went there based on reviews
text: Went there based on reviews put on TripAdvisor on my first evening in Athens. Cannot fault the service. As I told the waitress that I was v hungry, she recommended that I try the lamb kleftiko which was indeed a v large portion. Huge lamb shank slow cooked with loads of potatoes, cheese and some red peppers. Thank God I did not order bread as recommended by the waitress and I would have stuffed myself with loads of carbs. The restaurant gives a local drink similar to oozo and some little toasts on the house before the meal and another less strong but slightly sweet alcoholic drink with Greek yoghurt and a bit of fruit on top. Had I known that I would have not ordered the baklava. It was good too. This place is literally less than 5 steps after you leave the Acropolis metro station.

title: Great party venue, food and service
text: Just returned after a friend’s birthday party there. We were about 30+ people in a room and enjoyed a good selection of tandoor and curries. Particularly enjoyed the tandoori food. Had a lot of variety and all was tender and well cooked. Good car parking too

title: Never disappoints. I eat in.
text: Never disappoints. I eat in. Tried a few things and enjoyed all. Proper home cooked Indian food. They do not serve tap water but are happy if you carry your own bottled water. They do sell drinks and bottled water too. I always visit them when I am in the area. I am an Indian and miss dosas and theirs are first class

title: Good grills
text: Had dinner with 10 other friends yesterday. We all enjoyed the meal. Unfortunately the onion in my veg kebab was grilled with outer skin on and most of it tasted raw. Hence 4 rather than 5 stars. Place was so busy even at 6 pm. Best to book in advance. Ample parking on road. Good portion sizes. Will go again

title: So lucky to be treated here by friends
text: Amazing milk shakes with fancy names and great snacks. Great coffee shop with excellent service. Roadside parking is available.

title: Great food and service
text: Went there with a group of friends and was v impressed with the quality of food and service. Portion size was good too

title: Authentic South Indian food with horrible service
text: Cannot fault the food at all. Absolutely amazing. Very authentic South Indian food. However service was absolutely appalling. There was just 1 waitress who had a child tagging along behind her. We had a booking for 12 (incl 3 below 10 yrs). Got served after 1.5-2 hours. One person got the main before the starter although they insisted what appeared as a main was indeed a starter. The bill was wrong. They had undercharged us by a large amount with items missing on the bill. However we paid what we owed them. Will not go again as service was absolutely horrible. Kids wanted to leave after an hour when there was no sign of food. Many popular soft drinks were not available again. Will not go again.

title: So pleased they have got Good Food award. Very well deserved
text:
I am surprised to read 3 unfavourable reviews. I have not used the take away service and always sit there and eat. Always take a detour if I am travelled west on M62 back home or if I am in Batley. The place is run by a young Tamil couple who offer the most extensive menu. Not sure how they do it as all dishes always taste as if they are freshly cooked. I always have either the masala dosa or the chicken tikka dosa or their chilli chicken dosa but have tried some curries that friends have ordered. Their rotis are phulkas and come extremely hot. Some Indian dishes can be v oily if you want the authentic version.

I am from India which has diversity of food and can undeniably say that this family does justice to Indian food. Great value. Will continue to visit them. So pleased that they have also been recently awarded the Good Food Award. Very well deserved.

title: So beautiful
text: One of the most beautiful palaces I have been to. True to its location of bank of Bosphorus it has elements of both East and Western collections. Beautiful Bohemian crystal chandeliers and other articles, French vases and European vases and Chinese collections

title: Great tour and excellent customer service from the Back Office
text:
Excellent communications and support from the back office soon after I booked the flight and when I missed a pick up time at an attraction. The places you see are exemplary. We were also taken to a beautiful Bulgarian church which was not on the itenary and I am not sure if as a result of this trip the duration at the spice market was reduced.

I strongly recommend the spice market over the grand bazaar in Istanbul as the former is smaller and vendors are more than willing to sell smaller quantities of all food products. Generally the smallest box for Turkish delight is 500 g but here they will pack stuff in smaller quantities in plastic bags. Same with spices. You can buy 50-100g amounts compared to 250 g in Grand Bazaar. 1g contains of saffron are also available here.

What I really liked about this tour company over another I had used on the previous day is that they give you headphones and the tour guide actually comes with you to places of interest and gives a running commentary rather than getting a short commentary outside the attraction and free time to visit.

I highly recommend the tour and the tour company.
place: Bosphorus Full Day Tour: Bosphorus Cruise, Uskudar and Dolmabahce Palace

title: Loved this so much more than the Grand Bazaar
text: This place is a smaller version of the Grand bazaar and here the stall holders are happy to sell portion of spices and baklava too unlike the Grand bazaar where the smallest sized box if you were lucky is 259g - else 500g is the norm and 250g is minimum for spices. Fortunately in the spice market the traders are more than willing to sell smaller sized portions albeit not in fancy boxes. The spice market is v close to area where boat trips to Golden Horn and Bosphorus start. It is well served by the tram network too. You will find people speaking some English both inside and outside the market.

title: Best area to stay if you wish to walk to historic area easily
text:
This is the historical heart of the city with Sultan Ahmet (aka blue) mosque, Hagia Sophia, Basalica Cistern and Topiaki Palace v close by. A large part of the blue mosque and small parts of many other buildings are also under renovation. You come out of one of these and you can see the other or sign to it’s entrance. The famous Grand Bazaar and Spice markets are about 10-15 min walk away. Most of the area is pedestrianised. Strongly encourage you to wear comfortable footwear as you will be on your feet for a long time during your visit and streets are cobbled.

I stayed close to this area and it was so convenient.

title: Breathtakingly beautiful
text: All the historic sites are in walking distance and a good tram service stops here too. I explored it with a tour company and therefore had a guide. I did see tourists with audio tours. Helps to have guidance to but it in context. Unfortunately most of the blue mosque is under renovation. If you have to pay extra to go in, I would advice you not to waste your money as half of it is hidden. Many toilets in the vicinity too

title: Beautiful on a night cruise
text: So many architectural gems dotted on both the European and Asian sides. A must see either at day or night by boat if you have time

title: Amazing service and amazing service
text: How I wish I had discovered it on the very first night I got here. Found it accidentally on day 2 and although I was full and did not want a full meal, the dishes on the menu caught my attention and the host suggested I sample just a “small” starter made with aubergine called Imam Bayildi. The waitress too was so kind and hospitable. As usual not only did I get a free Turkish naan but had the most delicious tzasitki to go with it. My starter was amazing but the size of a main course. It was scrumptious and I promised the staff I would return again and I did. I was so hooked by the quality, quantity and customer service. Today based on the host’s recommendation I tried beef Guvec which was a Turkish stew on a hot casserole dish covered with an ornate Turkish container. The flavours did not disappoint. I am so sorry that I was here for a long weekend only. Else I would have tried more of their specialities. I do not hesitate to recommend this restaurant if you want an authentic Turkish dinner at an affordable price too.

title: Slow service and stray cats spoiling my dinner
text:
Went in after being greeted v warmly. At first I was seated near someone smoking a cigar and when asked to be moved to a non- smoking area I was given a lovely and comfortable seat. Unfortunately, even though there was a large non-smoking sign next to me, someone who appeared to be friends with the servers walked in and I could see from above that he wanted to light a cigarette. Guess what? He was sent upstairs and he lit his cigarette whilst still standing close to me. When I pointed to the non- smoking sign he looked bemused as if what is wrong with smoking. I appreciate that people smoke in restaurants in this country but would have thought that if a zone was marked non-smoking then it would be smoke free. I started feeling uncomfortable by now.

Then a stray cat wanders in as there are many stray cats and dogs in the city. Perched at a height waiting for my food to show up, I could see the Brits and Japanese loving this cat. Then soon after my sea bass was served, it understandingly did not want to budge and was trying to jump up to my seat. Being a non- cat lover I was trying to shoo it off but a waiter kindly came up to get rid of the cat. He even sat on stairs to block it. Soon after he moved the cat came back and poor chap came to my rescue again.

The sea bass was also quite bony and as you can imagine that by now I just wanted to pay and get out.

Due to this experience I am giving it a poor score but the food was not outstanding either. Sorry for giving a low score.

title: Great friendly and exceedingly helpful family run hotel
text:
I found this hotel based on reviews and proximity to the tourist sites and it is absolutely perfect for my needs- single woman traveller. It’s so central that a wall of Kopyaki palace faces its entrance although the entrance to the palace is less than 5 minutes away depending on tired your feet are! The view of Hagia Sophia from its roof terrace is the best I have managed to get. As all the tourist attractions are in exceedingly close proximity together you do not need to worry about transport. However the tram stops in the square with all tourist site so no more than a 10 min walk.

This family run hotel wants you to feel at home when you are their guest. The welcome I got when I arrived by an airport shuttle was so warm and friendly and two staff genuinely wanted to help me and I felt v bad after I politely refused as the bag was light.

There are some very good and reasonably priced restaurants almost round the corner.

The breakfast buffet was excellent and v good quality. It is suitable for people of all dietary types including vegans. The Turkish sausage and various cheeses are superb. Can’t wait to have them again tomorrow morning.

I will not hesitate to recommend this hotel and will return back if I come with friends or family who have not been to Turkey.

My room although in the basement has a double and single bed with a lovely wardrobe and dressing table. The bathroom is v modern with a walk-in rain shower that can be operated as a rain shower or hand shower. They provide lots of toiletries too. There is a mini bar in the room and a hair dryer in the bathroom. There is a TV and comfy chair. I have seen a guest leaving laundry at reception but I have not used it as I am here for a short break only. I have uploaded photos of my room, shower, reception/lobby, rooftop terrace restaurant and view of Hagia Sophia and the Marmara sea. One photo shows how close the hotel is from wall of Topiaki palace

title: Huge area to cover- quite interesting
text: Interesting place to visit with a guide or you can be self guided with headsets and clearly numbered areas. Very interesting displays of ways of cooking, artillery ( not my favourite generally but these are encrusted with semi-precious stones) and great views of the Bosporus and Asian part of Istanbul. There are so many red rose bushes and red hot lip salvia plants. The harem area was under renovation but there is still lots to see and do. Spent 2 h there. Very centrally located near other tourist attractions- all in 100x100sq metre area. Good tram service to location too.

title: Interesting but stinky
text: Not a place I would come back again too. Would not recommend it if you are short of time. Interior is dark with tall columns in a dark underground area. Two columns at the end where area smells like a sewer have some interesting columns with myths associated with them. The only thing I really enjoyed for the opportunity to get dressed like a Turkish man or woman depending on your sex. The photographer takes numerous photos with lots of props and there is no pressure to buy. If you have someone with you, you could get dressed and your companion could take your photos standing behind the photographer. Ssshhh- this is not official but easily doable. Photos are good and cost 6 euros or 40 TLR.

title: Quite interesting with a tour guide
text: Very interesting history that I could appreciate with our tour guide. Evidence of how Muslims tried to cover church symbols. Good toilets nearby. Centrally located and tram comes v close.

title: Under renovation for next few years so you see little
text: Very disappointed that a large part of the Grand Mosque was covered up and under renovation. Whatever that is seen is good and beautiful. Full of blue and white decorative tiles in different designs that give it its name. Very centrally located. Good toilets nearby and tram comes v close.

title: Amazing food with amazing service
text: One of my favourite Indian restaurants in UK and, the food reminds me of growing up in Mumbai. Absolutely authentic Indian food where the spices are used to add flavour and food is not spicy and run off the mill. Had been there a few months ago. Just had a super lunch at a friend’s party where a large selection of food was pre-ordered and served. We were not rushed and no request is too small. Sunita and the rest of the “crew” ensure that the guests have a great time. They serve with an authentic smile and I am looking forward to returning back next weekend. My favourites are malai tikka, sheesh kebab, butter chicken and lamb Biryani. All their chutneys are delicious too. Everything I have sampled is DELICIOUS in large capitals. Highly recommend the restaurant for a proper Indian meal. You will not be disappointed.

title: Worth paying to drive up and enjoy spectacular views
text: It’s an extremely beautiful drive and there are lots of places to park along the way and enjoy the spectacular views. There is a cafe near the top with a large car park. Worth paying £3.50 to drive on the long and winding road to enjoy the views

title: Great place for a bite to eat
text: Just outside the gardens and close to the car park and public toilets. Good selection of hot and cold food similar to most National Trust cafes. Quality of food was good and there was ample sitting. Very conveniently located to refuel yourself after a long journey before going to the gardens

title: Lovely shops near the exit of Bodnant gardens
text: Lovely shops near the exit of the gardens close to a cafe on the garden side of the road. Loved browsing in the craft shops. Had to strongly curtail the urge to buy stuff which was beautiful, well made and reasonably priced. A large variety of crafts and paintings to enjoy viewing or buying.

title: Beautiful garden in all seasons
text: Visited it for the first time yesterday with friends who had praised it highly. As a keen gardener, I was impressed with the variety and quality of flowers and flower beds. It appears to have been planted to have colour all year round. With so many trees, autumn should be colourful too. I loved their rose garden. Parking is ample and free. You pay to visit the gardens but national trust members can go free. Has a lovely cafe near the car park. Toilets are near the car park and exit to the gardens only. Had a lovely day out and will certainly make the 2 h journey to visit it again.

title: Great Chinese food enjoyed by Chinese families too
text: This was my second visit with friends who frequently visit the restaurant. Food never disappoints. Great service and no request is neglected. My favourite Chinese restaurant when I visit Manchester. So many Chinese families of different generations are seen celebrating special events too

title: AMAZING in extremely large capitals
text: Just returned after having lunch there with 19 other friends and kids. Quality and quantity of the food was excellent. The large portion ordered by one person was extremely large and although he has a good appetite he could not finish it. Will most definitely go ahead many more times in future. Quite close to j24 on M62 and has a decent size car park. Great views too.

title: Great day out for people of all ages
text: I enjoy going there periodically and one never knows what to expect with visiting artists. Took a visitor on a fleeting visit today and the visiting artist had mixed styles. I remembered seeing more Henry Moore (HM) sculptures closer to the main entrance but struggled to see them today. Was disappointed to find aircraft engine on the first lawn. Would have been nicer to have a HM sculpture closer. Fortunately on our drive out, we could see a few HM sculptures at a distance. Fortunately the beauty of the location is always breathtaking and serene.

title: Best place to buy traditional Yorkshire baked goods
text: I love this bakery that is situated on the main cobbled street with bespoke shops, close to the Bronte Parsonage in Haworth. The quality of their goods has been consistent at least for last 14 years whilst I have lived in Yorkshire. I enjoy their fat rascals ( yes, this is what they are called- similar to a large cookie but not too sweet) and the Yorkshire curd tart. If they had a branch in Huddersfield where I live, I would go and treat myself often and buy their freshly made products as gifts from Yorkshire. They have a cafe at the back too that I have never visited. I strongly recommend all tourists to Howarth to visit this bakery. It’s on the right hand side as you walk down the cobbled street at the Parsonage end. I can not recommend it enough. Fortunately I found the packaging of my half eaten “rascal “ to remember its name to review it here.

title: Always v popular with tourists
text: Took my old English school teacher visiting from India over there. She found it interesting. Each room has descriptions on frames and it’s worth reading. There are v helpful young volunteers and museum assistants at both levels and they are exceedingly knowledgeable. You MUST remember to ask one of them about paper arrows on the wall in the children’s nursery. They will guide you on how to see v faint sketches ( which is beautiful graffiti drawn on walls by the children). It is no explained about this. We were v disappointed with the special light show in the basement at special times in the day. We would have missed it as I do not remember reading any posters for the same. Learnt about it as I was chatting with a young assistant. There are costumes that both adults and kids can wear and take personal photos too. There is a pay and display car park v close to the parsonage and a ramp to get there easily. There are no public toilets in the parsonage which is disappointing due to lack of space. Howarth is a lovely town with speciality shops and eateries on a v steep hill. I suggest that if anyone has mobility issues they park on top and walk down hill and let a fit person walk back to the car whilst others wait down the hill on the at the end of shops or outside the garden to be picked up. There is a bakery that sells proper Yorkshire specialities. Everything is exceptional especially their Yorkshire curd tarts and fat rascals that are not available easily elsewhere (especially outside Yorkshire).

title: Breathtakingly beautiful
text: I live in West Yorkshire and regularly take visitors there. You only pay £10 car parking fees and you can park multiple times in any of the 3 car parks on site. Thanks to the heavy rain over the weekend, the stepping stones were totally submerged and the water was gushing. Never fails to impress. There are places to eat and toilet facilities near 2 of the car parks. I have never stopped at the third ( near the strid), so I cannot comment.

title: More attractions added for summer
text: Was pleasantly surprised that a huge car park has opened up with a mock beach, donkey rides and large machinery exhibits. A toy train can also transport you from the car park to the main entrance. There was a £5 car park ticket and was surprised to be charged an entry fee of £5 per person too. However I have got tokens too with ticket to have free entry thereafter. I do not grudge the payments as it a great visitor attraction. I must have gone after 6 years to observe the changes. The exhibition looked bigger too. Had a great outing as expected.

title: Enjoyed the Sunday lunch
text: About 12 of us had Sunday lunch and were very pleased with portion size and quality of roasts. Kids had a good selection too. There is a la carte choices on Sun too. Free parking available at back of pub. Sign seen clearly in one approach only. Unfortunately I was driving in the opposite direction and found out later. Found free kerbside parking

title: Great location. And v clean and comfortable hotel
text: Was v pleased to have booked here for a long weekend in Atlanta. Most tourist places are in walking distance. Service is great. Very clean and comfortable. Has a restaurant on site. Parking is pricey. Peach tree Marta is 2 blocks away. Will use it again

title: AMAZING in huge capitals
text: It’s a busy eatery and I can now understand why we had to queue for 15 mins at 3 pm on a Fri. Great food. Loved the cheese grits and chicken sandwich with crumbly biscuits. Must try it out if you are in the area

title: First taste of southern food
text: This was my induction to southern food and really enjoyed it. Will highly recommend it. Need to book in advance if you are in a group. Great food and service. Will go again if I am in the area.

title: Convenient for Sheraton guests
text: Decent choice of food. Good quality and convenient if you do not want to go out and find eateries. Part of Sheraton Hotel and parking on site is v pricey. Will use it again if I use the hotel

title: Used it to walk bet attractions
text: Huge park in downtown Atlanta with places of tourist interest on the periphery. There are some small monuments to mark the 1996 Olympics. Used for events too which can cause traffic jams

title: AMAZING in capital letters
text: I had bought a VIP tour ticket that includes a guided tour to places where there is action. The venue is huge and there are shops and eateries to browse whilst you wait. Would highly recommend the VIP experience. All tickets are timed so if you buy the Atlanta pass you need to swap it for a timed ticket at the ticket office

title: Very informative
text: It’s just about American civil rights. A third of displays - most of the top floor is extremely topical. That was a pleasant surprise. Would recommend it
place: National Center for Civil and Human Rights

title: Huge garden with lots of fun things for kuds
text: Kids have lots to do to drain their energy. Water park, place to build huts, slides, tree houses... Only had 3h so could not explore everything. Lots of well maintained flora too and would definitely go there again on another trip to Atlanta. No Marta station nearby but has parking but not free

title: Great visit
text: Had bought a vip pass to avoid the lines but with hindsight I could have walked in and done everything and tasted all the unlimited free samples. Advantage was having a tour guide. It was informative and I would not go again

title: Conveniently located near attractions
text: Nothing to rave about. Decent selection of food while you are out and about. The waitress forgot to give me discount with my Coke museum VIP but it was a few cents so I used that as her tip

title: Great place to spend with kids
text: It’s a good aquarium but unfortunately I have seen a better one in Singapore where they have shows. This one did not but great variety of fishes. Centrally located with other attractions in walking distance. Car parking is close by but not free.

title: European food in Atlanta
text: Had brunch with friends and it was amazing. The pastries were mouth watering but I resisted the urge. Portions are not huge. Great quality with good free parking.

title: Good place for quick bite to eat and see the lake
text: Reasonably priced eatery at the pier whilst you wait for your boat. From hot/cold sandwiches, loaded jacket potatoes , few cooked meals, beverages, ice creams and tempting dessserts you can find something for everyone. There some souvenirs to buy too. Have been there on almost every visit to Ambleside pier.

title: Accidentally found but good
text: Found this by accident and tried it out and weren’t disappointed. Regional dishes v well cooked and felt as if meat was locally sourced.

title: Good to enjoy west end musicals in the nortn
text: I have been there many times and love the ambience. Legroom is better in the stalks than upper circle. I am 5’3” and am ok. Parking can be pricey in NCP car parks near Edward St but if you are lucky on street parking again near Edward street is £3 after 6 pm. Although you are allowed to go in to use the toilets from 6:30 pm, the auditorium opens at 7 pm for 7:30pm shows. I like the friendly staff there too.

title: Great value for money
text: Good food served by excellent waiting staff. May have to wait in line but if you do, try and find a server and make your presence known as they create a waiting list based on names they have collected.

title: Good Italian food served in generous portions
text:
Visited this restaurant on Mother’s Day with friends and was happy with both the quality and quantity. My rib eye steak and deep fried mozzarella ( thick, large slices rather than sticks) were delicious. The other dishes ordered by friends that I sampled were equally good. I was full with the starter and main course.

The place has a medium sized car park at the back of the restaurant. Will go again if I am in the area.

title: This is now called Chopsticks
text:
The same staff cook and serve the delicious food as always albeit the traditional Chinese selection ordered by those from the Far East is slightly reduced.

The dining area is removed and it is now a takeaway. I have just recommended Tripadvisor to add Chopsticks as it’s own entry. Hope reviewers start using that entry once available.

title: Nothing extra-ordinary but nothing to complain either
text: I use this to travel to India each Dec. Its part of the star alliance and has got an extensive network. Food and service are good - nothing to rave about though. Good value for money

title: Comfortable seats in economy with more legroom
text: I love travelling on Emirates. Most importantly, the legroom is generous and the entertainment selection appears almost endless. Food and customer service are good too. Luggage allowance in economy is 30 kg even if part of your journey is with a partner low cost airline

title: Best way to travel in Singspore
text: Fast, clean, reliable and safe way to travel. Well connected with the bus network but if in doubt use the MRT and then take taxi to final destination

title: Amazing quality of plants
text: Must see when you are in Singapore. Very good selection and quality of plants. However plant combinations are not true to reality. I recommend that you buy the separate walkway ticket too

title: Good restaurant at Changi airport but pricey
text: Had dinner before departure at Changi with family. Good selection of food but a bit pricey for an airport restaurant. Good portion sizes

title: Overpriced
text: The cheap to prepare pasta and pizza come large but are as pricey as smaller fish or steak dishes which do not really fill you up. The ambience of a posh restaurant enables them to overprice. Parking is on a busy road although a free car park is not far away. Apart from our group there was no one else on a Sat afternoon

title: Great value for money
text: I go there at least once every 2 years when I need good quality clothes and shoes at affordable prices. Ample free parking is a bonus too.

title: Love this- never fails to impress
text: I am surprised to read 3 unfavourable reviews. I have not used the take away service and always sit there and eat. Always take a detour if I am travelled west on M62 back home or if I am in Batley. The place is run by a young Tamil couple who offer the most extensive menu. Not sure how they do it as all dishes always taste as if they are freshly cooked. I always have either the masala dosa or the chicken tikka dosa but have tried some curries that friends have ordered. Their rotis are phulkas and come extremely hot. I am from India which has diversity of food and can undeniably say that this family does justice to Indian food. Great value. Will continue to visit them.

title: Lots to do
text: Went to this island mainly for the big Buddha. Did not realise this is a recently developed tourist attraction with steep deep steps to climb up to see Big Buddha. There are also virtual reality experiences, some exciting immersive games, restaurants and cafes. For a strange reason unknown to me the 7/11 store was closed over a long lunch period when tourists would use it the most. I missed the last bus to explore a sleepy fishing village. Spent the best part of a day here. I gather there are lovely nature trails too but I did not have time or energy to explore them during my short visit. Would strongly encourage to take the Cable car to get there to enjoy the spectacular views. I did see some people walk up the hill. God knows how long it would take to climb from the base to Big Buddha

title: Kowloon harbour front also called TST
text: Great view of HK island can be seen from here. You can also enjoy the free light show from here with lasers from HK side. Very lively in the evening after dark

title: Thoroughly enjoyed the ride on the glass bottomed cabin
text: Be prepared to stand in a queue especially if you wish to go to Big Buddha in the morning. You have a choice of glass or ordinary bottomed capsule at different prices. I was in the glass bottomed cabin which was interesting but to be honest you look straight ahead and get lost admiring the spectacular views that you forget to look below. Every other cabin is a glass bottomed one and as it is s bit pricier you are likely to on your way faster if you pay the bit extra. Most certainly the best way to go to big Buddha. If budget is tight buy a 1 way ticket and return back by bus.
